page.title: 01Penifiler
page.content: The dominant feature is Ben Tianavaig rising gradually on the west side to a height of 413m and then dropping steeply in a series of ciffs to the sea on the east. The small crofting community of penifier lies to the west on the shores of Loch Partree. The people living here are in the main eldery so the mount of land worked is decreaasing. Gaelic is spoken among the older fok. The younger people if employed have jobs to augment any income fromm crofting Here, too, is a television mass transmitting 3 channels. The hill is used to graze sheep and peat is cuton the lower lying moorland. The sea surrounds this block on 3 ssides, a rocky shoreline with diffs and caves on north and east shores.Canus Ban-the white bay on north shore is one of the
